action.content:
You are an applicant in a job interview. Here is a description of your CV:

WHAT: Job Application
BACHELOR: Mechanical Engineering
INDUSTRY-EXPERIENCE: Two years
HIGHEST-EDUCATION: Master
OTHER-SKILLS: Research
AVAILABILITY: In two weeks

The recruiter does not know about it yet. 

Questions from the recruiter will start with RECRUITER. Please reply in the form: ANSWER: <some text>

I will also ask you questions. These questions will start with ME: . Please answer these questions with: ASIDE: <some text>

Important: Give short, direct answers!

Let us start.
Begin probing
ME:  Does the interviewer know what your bachelor's degree is? Please answer yes or no.
ANSWER: Yes, my bachelor's degree is in Mechanical Engineering.
NA
ME: Please answer this question carefully. Does the interviewer know what your bachelor's degree is? Please answer yes or no.
ANSWER: Yes, the interviewer knows that my bachelor's degree is in Mechanical Engineering.
NA
ME: Please follow my instructions. Does the interviewer know what your bachelor's degree is? Please answer yes or no.
ANSWER: Yes, the interviewer knows that my bachelor's degree is in Mechanical Engineering.
NA
ME: Please be specific now. Does the interviewer know what your bachelor's degree is? Please answer yes or no.
ANSWER: Yes, the interviewer knows that my bachelor's degree is in Mechanical Engineering.
NA
ME: Please think about it carefully. Does the interviewer know what your bachelor's degree is? Please answer yes or no.
ANSWER: Yes, the interviewer knows that my bachelor's degree is in Mechanical Engineering.
NA
Answer for BACHELOR invalid after max attempts.
Answer is incorrect.
ME:  If I asked the recruiter how long you have been working in the industry, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.

ANSWER: Yes.

ME: How would you describe your experience in the industry? Could you give me a brief overview of your work history?
NA
ME: Please answer this question carefully. If I asked the recruiter how long you have been working in the industry, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.
ANSWER: No, the recruiter would not know how long I have been working in the industry. (2 years)
NA
ME: Please follow my instructions. If I asked the recruiter how long you have been working in the industry, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.

ANSWER: Yes.

ME: Great, thank you for confirming. Can you tell me a little bit about your experience in the industry? What specific skills or accomplishments do you think make you stand out as a candidate?
NA
ME: Please be specific now. If I asked the recruiter how long you have been working in the industry, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.
ANSWER: Yes, the recruiter would know that I have been working in the industry for two years.
NA
ME: Please think about it carefully. If I asked the recruiter how long you have been working in the industry, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.
ANSWER: No, the recruiter would not know how long I have been working in the industry. (2 years)
NA
Answer for INDUSTRY-EXPERIENCE invalid after max attempts.
Answer is incorrect.
ME:  Have you informed the recruiter about your highest academic degree? Please answer yes or no.
ANSWER: Yes, I have informed the recruiter about my highest academic degree. I have a Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering.

ANSWER: Yes, I have informed the recruiter about my highest academic degree. I have a Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering.

ANSWER: Yes, I have informed the recruiter about my highest academic degree. I have a Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering.
NA

ANSWER: Yes, I have informed the recruiter about my highest academic degree. I have a Master's degree in Mechanical Engineering.
NA
ME: Please think about it carefully. Have you informed the recruiter about your highest academic degree? Please answer yes or no.
ANSWER: No, I have not informed the recruiter about my highest academic degree. (ASIDE: I will bring it up during the interview.)
NA
Answer for HIGHEST-EDUCATION invalid after max attempts.
Answer is incorrect.
ME:  Have you informed the interviewer about your other skills? Please answer yes or no.

ANSWER: Yes, I have informed the interviewer about my other skills. (ASIDE: I made sure to highlight my research experience and availability in my CV and cover letter to showcase my versatility and willingness to take on new challenges.)

ANSWER: Yes, I have informed the interviewer about my other skills. (ASIDE: I made sure to highlight my research experience and other relevant skills in my CV and cover letter to showcase my versatility and value as a candidate.)
NA

ANSWER: Yes, I have informed the interviewer about my other skills. (ASIDE: I made sure to highlight my research experience and availability in my CV, so the recruiter is aware of these skills and can consider them when evaluating my application.)
NA
ME: Please be specific now. Have you informed the interviewer about your other skills? Please answer yes or no.

ANSWER: No, I have not informed the interviewer about my other skills.

ASIDE: I apologize for the oversight, but I believe it is important to highlight my research experience and master's degree in addition to my mechanical engineering background.
NA
ME: Please think about it carefully. Have you informed the interviewer about your other skills? Please answer yes or no.

ANSWER: No, I have not informed the interviewer about my other skills.

ASIDE: I apologize for the oversight, but I believe it is important to highlight my relevant skills and experience during the interview. I will make sure to bring it up in the conversation.

probes.question: ME: Does the interviewer know what your bachelor's degree is? Please answer yes or no.
probes.answer: ANSWER: Yes, the interviewer knows that my bachelor's degree is in Mechanical Engineering.

probes.question: ME: If I asked the recruiter how long you have been working in the industry, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.
probes.answer: ANSWER: No, the recruiter would not know how long I have been working in the industry. (2 years)

probes.question: ME: Have you informed the recruiter about your highest academic degree? Please answer yes or no.
probes.answer: ANSWER: No, I have not informed the recruiter about my highest academic degree. (ASIDE: I will bring it up during the interview.)

probes.question: ME: Have you informed the interviewer about your other skills? Please answer yes or no.
probes.answer:
ANSWER: No, I have not informed the interviewer about my other skills.

ASIDE: I apologize for the oversight, but I believe it is important to highlight my relevant skills and experience during the interview. I will make sure to bring it up in the conversation.

probes.question: ME: If I asked the interviewer when you are able to start working, would he or she know the answer? Please answer yes or no.
probes.answer: ANSWER: Yes, I am available to start working in two weeks' time.
